items.title: The Spaces That Make Cities Fairer and More Resilient
items.abstract: Our shared economy depends most on what happens in between.

items.title: A Renaissance in Rapid City, S.D.
items.abstract: In recent years, the once-seedy downtown area in this city near Mount Rushmore has developed a surprising eco-sensibility and a thriving art scene.

items.title: Over 21 Miles of Highway, Snapshots of a Resilient Houston
items.abstract: The stretch of I-45 that leads downtown from near George Bush Intercontinental Airport captures some of the essence of what has often been a misunderstood city.

items.title: Scarred but Resilient, New York City Tiptoes Toward Normalcy
items.abstract: The city reopened hesitantly, as New Yorkers balanced caution with a desire to embrace the freedom of prepandemic life.

items.title: How New York City’s Hospitals Withstood the Omicron Surge
items.abstract: The highly contagious coronavirus variant stretched the city’s health care system to the breaking point, but not past it.
